diff_hunk:
@@ -649,6 +662,24 @@ using OpConverter =
 
 class Converter {
  public:
+  // During conversion, this table is populated with quantization scales per tensor
+  std::unordered_map<nvinfer1::ITensor*, float> quantization_scales_;
+  // This table contains tensors which need to have their quantization ranges
+  // copied later. For example, we convert MatMul to the following TRT layers
+  // with intermediate tensors x, y, and z:
+  //
+  //    -> Shuffle -> MatMul -> Shuffle ->
+  //     w          x         y          z
+  // 
+  // Tensors w and z will have quantization ranges supplied by the user. We can
+  // infer that x will have the same range as w because Shuffle(reshape) does
+  // not change any values. We can also infer that y will have the same range as
+  // z, but since nodes are converted sequentially, at this point we don't have
+  // the range for z yet. So we add an entry to this next table:
+  // quantization_infer_backwards[z] = y;
+  // Later on, we will copy the range of z over to y.
+  std::unordered_map<nvinfer1::ITensor*, nvinfer1::ITensor*> quantization_infer_backwards_;
